alert.note: Alert for North Central; Northeast; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued September 09 at 10:23PM ADT until September 12 at 7:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM AST SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SUNDAY TO 6 PM AST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet, and occasionally higher. Breakers will surpass 10 feet after 6 PM AST Sunday night. * WHERE...for the north and east-facing beaches of Puerto Rico from Aguadilla to Fajardo and Culebra. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, from Sunday morning through Wednesday afternoon. For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 PM Sunday to 6 PM AST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Rip currents that can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water where it becomes difficult to return to safety. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...It is very likely that the High Rip Current Risk statements and High Surf Advisory might be extended through most of next week as Hurricane Lee continues moving northward over the western Atlantic. Coastal Flood Advisories may be required later tomorrow.
info.instruction: There is a high risk of rip currents. Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as groins, jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and signs. If you become caught in a rip current, yell for help. Remain calm, do not exhaust yourself and stay afloat while waiting for help. If you have to swim out of a rip current, swim parallel to shore and back toward the beach when possible. Do not attempt to swim directly against a rip current as you will tire quickly.

area.areaDesc: North Central; Northeast; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity
